summary: We examined state and local government spending and revenue trends. From 1998–2018, state and local government spending increased by about $1.1 trillion to about $2.8 trillion. Revenues increased by about $1 trillion, to about $2.6 trillion. Health spending had the largest increase, rising to 24% of all spending in 2018 Federal grants were the fastest growing source of revenue We also gathered experts’ views on...
title: Intergovernmental Issues: Key Trends and Issues Regarding State and Local Sector Finances
